As a concept, the wendigo can apply to any person, idea, or movement infected by a corrosive drive toward self-aggrandizing greed and excessive consumption, traits that sow disharmony and destruction if left unchecked. Ojibwe scholar Brady DeSanti asserts that the wendigo "can be understood as a marker indicating... a person... imbalanced both internally and toward the larger community of human and spiritual beings around them." Out of equilibrium and estranged by their communities, individuals thought to be afflicted by the wendigo spirit unravel and destroy the ecological balance around them.

‚ÄîWikipedia, ‚ÄúWendigo‚Äù

êëÑ wendigo is a concept that consumes yr mind from êëÑ outside in, destroying all else in its gnawing hunger

for most of us, there is no wendigo in our minds. however, we live in a world in which many do conceive & incubate such horrors. many times a drive for ‚Äúauthenticity‚Äù & êëÑ concomitant social approbation seal in toxic & unbalanced ideas. they do this by

  1. praising êëÑ pursuit of authenticity & elevating its satisfaction over other social goods
  2. showering êëÑ victim in a heap of positive attention thereby warping or short-circuiting êëÑ normal feedback loops which would else decay this into a passing phase
  3. providing êëÑ ocean in which such fish swim

while big woke is responsible for many of these abominations in an in-yr-face sense, much of edumacation, family formation, social signaling, & religion similarly compromises êëÑ participant

maintaining mental hygiene means auditing & honestly recognizing any such impulses in yrself like êëÑ weeds they r. ‚à¥ it means uprooting these weeds in yr environment as much as possible: yr friends & family & those over whom u have responsibility | stewardship

how should one read a text? first, one must have a mutual trust with êëÑ author that êëÑ labor was completed in good faith; ‚àÉ most certainly wicked books & while one may glean profit from them regardless they are √± a good place to learn to read deeply. similarly, books can change and one must sometimes be on one's guard even with an old friend

that said, one may adopt particular levels of formality in reading a text

an old and wise document such as scripture or received texts from ages past may profitably be very closely read (altho of course one must trust êëÑ translator! which is why i prefer êëÑ king james version)

why is this word there? what does it mean? wherefrom was it translated and does it preserve sense? why does this sentence have êëÑ rhythm it possesses, and does it concede sense to form? should it? how do êëÑ lines and stories and scenes support each other and êëÑ thesis? is êëÑ thesis visible or invisible? and so forth

a young book may be wise beyond its years (jonathan strange and mr norrell, for instance, or zen & êëÑ art of motorcycle maintenance), but in general √± trust anyone under one hundred years of age w/o vouching

one must take particular care w/ academic products of whatever form

first, they were brewed in a vat of unquenchable stench; indeed, perhaps only technical documents published before 1991 escape êëÑ whiff of brimstone

secondly, they simply cannot be trusted; they have an agenda & they will lie to u promiscuously

thirdly, their composition suffers greatly & there is √± reason to think the authors great prose stylists & so yr best option is to smash & grab for what u require

(it is worth a brief detour to address my election of stylistic fault: this is a choice of character, & ‚Äúneuroasketic‚Äù is as much a character as any other pseud)

to become over-familiar with one weapon is as much a fault as not knowing it sufficiently well

2021-06-14 13:57:53

neuroasketic

neuroasketic

You should not have a favourite weapon. To become over-familiar with one weapon is as much a fault as not knowing it sufficiently well. You should not copy others, but use weapons which you can handle properly. It is bad for commanders and troopers to have likes and dislikes. These are things you must learn thoroughly.

(miyamoto musashi, the book of five rings)

have no favorite tool. cultivate methodological anarchism

this is why i am a polar fox: method is a false god. there is no one true method

the only method is meta-method. the only meta-method is meta-meta-method. u as human r limited by yr capacity to stack abstraction

but yr capacity to stack abstraction is a house of cards. build w/ care

an author‚Äôs ability to solve conflict with magic is directly proportional to how well the reader understands said magic

2021-06-14 00:31:20

neuroasketic

neuroasketic

in brandon sanderson's novel mistborn he posits a unique magical system based on ‚Äúburning‚Äù trace amounts of rare metals in one's system

this visual returns to me as i consider attention as fuel

most of the time yr attention is being flared off like natural gas in africa

yet attention has increasing marginal utility. it follows a law of increasing returns. the value of each additional quantum of attention outstrips that of the last, perhaps geometrically

u can demonstrate this to yrself by running the claim backwards: once distracted from a focused task, each additional distraction has a marginal effect. to multitask eleven items is √± more helpful than to multitask twelve items. once the spell has been broken any peasant can wander on êëÑ scene

yr aim as mentat is to cultivate a skill of attention surplus. there are a few ways to deal with distractions:

  1. deal w/ distraction when it arises (rapid interrupt cycle)
  2. cache distraction (delayed interrupt cycle)
  3. reframe s. t. distractions are forgiven (forgiveness cycle) [e.g. accept consequences as circumstances and move forwards]
  4. hone ability to focus (unbroken cycle)

this last is a paramount skill: blinders on yr ability to reason, stillness amid the storm. meditation (any of the three varieties) can aid this, as can embodied cognitive caches

attention is the coin of the realm. as such, yr attention is under constant unrelenting assault. everything from notifications to tabbed browsing to advertising in its manifold forms‚Ä¶ these are only the first steps on a long journey

as a modern, yr life is structured around addictions to some extent (and quite possibly to a large extent). u r a fatty living in a chocolate palace

naval sez:

All pleasure creates its own offsetting pain and fear of loss. ‚Ä¶ The modern struggle is standing up to these weaponized addictions. They give you small doses of pleasure, but they also desensitize you and expose you to the misery of their absence.

or again, gollumization takes place at fractal layers of yr reality

i've said before that u have chosen yr own disease. until u defeat the simple bosses of spastic dopamine hits as u check for updates notifications replies comments pageviews like a hamster running in a wheel, how can u face the next tier of bosses? these bosses include music, connectivity, electricity, habits of reading, tics of behavior, insufficient dedication to will one thing, mortification of the flesh

pursue stillness of mind. there are three forms of meditation which u should engage in:

1) no-mind (zen-style emptying of thought) 2) discursive (extended silent inquisition of a proposition or idea) 3) observational (mostly sitting in nature; sometimes solvitur ambulando)

each of these trains yr mind like a vine on a trellis, or better like an ant leaving a pheromone trail for the next ant to follow

if you think good architecture is expensive, try bad architecture

2021-06-08 17:51:11

neuroasketic

neuroasketic

Design space might be thought of as a vast, dark, largely unexplored forest. Useful potential paths through it might be thought of as encompassing working programs. The space off to the sides of these paths is much larger realm of non-working programs. From any given point, a few small steps in most directions take you from a working to a non-working program. From time to time, there are forks in the path, indicating a choice among working alternatives. In unexplored territory, the prudent strategy is never to stray too far from the path. Now, if one has a map, a shortcut through the trekless thicket that might save miles may be evident. Of course, pioneers, by definition, don‚Äôt have maps. By taking small steps in any direction, they know that it is never more than a few steps back to a working system.

---foote & yoder, ‚Äúbig ball of mud‚Äù

the dark forest is not all bad news!

2) moral valence represents system one feedback to system two

3) moral valence can be attached to new things currently neutral: system two feedback to system one

navigating the dark forest is not an inherently masculine project, although i rather expect that strategies must differ for men and women due to signalling and psychic structure

epistemic hygiene in the sense i mean it here is largely if not exclusively a masculine project, at least in the sense that i expect that only a psychically-masculine mind would be able to carry it out and benefit from what i herein labor to produce

it forms an essential part of masculinity to face outwards from the hearth and circle of fire and into the night. the lesbianrx and g/acc claim that the feminization of humanity is underway; true, but as long as there is the night outside the firelight there will be masculinity

and the night never sleeps

as a man u have the consummate responsibility to carry the fire. not every fire is yr fire but there is a fire that is yrs and if u √± have it now then it is for u to find and harbor it

Competence and usefulness have‚Äîdesign constraints. Gaining them changes you. For men, they are necessary changes. But not everything necessary is entirely good. There‚Äôs often a cost. A favorite saying of mine: ‚ÄúEach man is a little war.‚Äù If so, each man bears the scars of that war.

There are some virtues that independence precludes. Untroubled sleep, carefree enjoyment, an easy smile, reflexive kindness, innocent trust. Beautiful, impractical clothing. Faith in another. Goodness without power.

These are sacred, holy things, and we must treat them with care.

(spdi, ‚Äúnotes on femininity‚Äù)

I had two dreams about him after he died. I dont remember the first one all that well but it was about meetin him in town somewheres and he give me some money and I think I lost it. But the second one it was like we was both back in older times and I was on horseback goin through the mountains of a night. Goin through this pass in the mountains. It was cold and there was snow on the ground and he rode past me and kept on goin. Never said nothin. He just rode on past and he had this blanket wrapped around him and he had his head down and when he rode past I seen he was carryin fire in a horn the way people used to do and I could see the horn from the light inside of it. About the color of the moon. And in the dream I knew that he was goin on ahead and that he was fixin to make a fire somewhere out there in all that dark and all that cold and I knew that whenever I got there he would be there. And then I woke up.

(cormac mccarthy, no country for old men)

the root of the matter

2021-06-06 01:58:27

neuroasketic

neuroasketic

why seek out the original sources of tales and sayings? let me give you two examples which have yielded interesting fruit:

  1. teach a man to fish. kuan tzu, a chinese philosopher, said, ‚Äúif you give a man a fish, he will have a single meal; if you teach him how to fish, he will eat all his life‚Äù

    this adds little to the common account but one can attach a name at last to the tale

  2. the starfish on the beach. i hear u cringe already. this tale is wretched, told so fecklessly by elementary school teachers and in forwarded emails from the 90s. what could possible result from tracking down the origin? behold

    Loren Eiseley walked along a stormy beach late one afternoon ‚Äúwith the wind roaring at his back and the seagulls screaming‚Äù overhead. Tourists who came to the beach would collect shellfish and sea life tossed up each night, boil them in large kettles, and take the shells home as souvenirs. Eiseley walked far down the beach around a point away from the collectors and saw ‚Äúa gigantic rainbow of incredible perfection.‚Äù Toward its foot he ‚Äúdiscerned a human figure ‚Ä¶ gazing ‚Ä¶ at something in the sand.‚Äù

    ‚ÄúIn a pool of sand ‚Ä¶ a starfish had thrust its arms up stiffly and was holding its body away from the stifling mud. ‚Ä¶ [‚ÄúIs it still alive?‚Äù Eiseley asked.]

    ‚Äú‚ÄòYes,‚Äô‚Äù [said the man standing in the rainbow] and with a quick ‚Ä¶ gentle movement he picked up the star and spun it ‚Ä¶ far out into the sea.

    ‚ÄúIt may live,‚Äù he said, ‚Äúif the offshore pull is strong enough. ‚Ä¶‚Äù

    At first Eiseley felt only the futility of the man‚Äôs efforts, ‚Äúthrowing one starfish at a time back into the sea when it nightly tosses out hundreds.‚Äù He walked away, looking sadly ‚Äúat the shell collectors ‚Ä¶ [and] the steaming kettles in which ‚Ä¶ voiceless things were being boiled alive.‚Äù

    The next morning Eiseley again went to the beach. Again the star thrower was there. ‚ÄúSilently [Eiseley] ‚Ä¶ picked up a still-living star, spinning it far out into the waves. ‚Ä¶ ‚ÄòI understand,‚Äô [he] said. ‚ÄòCall [me a star] thrower [also].‚Äô‚Äù

    Of throwing the starfish back he wrote, ‚ÄúIt was like a sowing‚Äîthe sowing of life on an infinitely gigantic scale. ‚Ä¶‚Äù He saw the star thrower stoop and throw once more. Eiseley joined with him. They ‚Äúflung and flung again while all about [them] roared the insatiable waters.‚Äù

    They, ‚Äúalone and small in that immensity, hurled back the living stars.‚Äù They set their shoulders and ‚Äúcast, ‚Ä¶ slowly, deliberately, and well. The task was not to be assumed lightly.‚Äù (Loren Eiseley, The Star Thrower (New York: Harcourt, Brace, Jovanovich, 1978), pp. 171‚Äì73, 184.)

    thus a saccharine self-congratulation is rendered instead a grimdark struggle against eternal night

seek out the roots of things & u will be rewarded

this may sound pleonastic

2021-06-05 17:03:59

neuroasketic

neuroasketic

harry frankfurt defines ‚Äòbullshit‚Äô as words spoken in order "to impress the listener and the reader with words that communicate an impression that something is being or has been done, words that are neither true nor false, and so obscure the facts of the matter being discussed." (i am citing wikipedia instead of on bullshit, but as i recall this is a faithful rendition of his final settled proposal)

i want a word or shorthand phrase for a related concept: ‚Äúan authoritative statement delivered under conditions of moral hazard.‚Äù this property is related to bullshit in a colloquial sense, but isn't synonymous with it

  • having ‚Äúskin in the game‚Äù is also related to this nexus
  • ‚Äúregulatory capture‚Äù is one way this manifests
  • ‚Äúhumbug‚Äù is close, per frankfurt, but not quite it: ‚Äúdeceptive misrepresentation, short of lying, especially by pretentious word or deed, of somebody‚Äôs own thoughts, feelings, or attitudes‚Äù
  • similarly for ‚Äúguff‚Äù, ‚Äúdrivel‚Äù, ‚Äúpablum‚Äù, and the like

terminological suggestions? what about reviving ‚Äúukaze‚Äù in this sense?

no ally more potent than the unborn

2021-06-04 21:24:14

neuroasketic

neuroasketic

This is a beast that cannot be destroyed from within. It can only be taken over from within, and once the methods of control are seized by rebels within, they, like all revolutionaries before them, will be corrupted by the power they wield and the entire rancid system will lurch along like a scab-shedding ghoul until it is finally felled by an external force, natural or manmade.

Until that time the best a truth-seeker can do is preserve an alternative to the Lie which binds the mindless, so that the mindful of the future might have some means of self-inoculation against the renewal of the cycle of lies which is the sacred heart of Human Civilization. Two nights ago, at a bar in the high deserts of America, I made the mindful acquaintance of a man much younger and much smarter than myself, who told me of a common article of wisdom in his field of work‚Äîa field beyond my comprehension‚Äîthat, in the Eye of the System, the negation matrix we call Civilization and suckle to as if the she-fiend is our true mother, that thought power, or a person‚Äôs power level, is a function of that mind‚Äôs ability to endure exposure to taboo thoughts, that the ability to ‚Äúthink outside the box‚Äù is so rare and so limited among humans, that most of humanity cannot bear to consider a notion or a truth counter to the mind control lies they have been weened and raised on, without suffering severe emotional distress.

This struck me like an epiphany that my task as a writer is not to reach people who exist in their mind within the Lie, subject to its taboos, but to write only for those who possess the powers of mind to think outside the box that is our social lie without running back to cling on its apron strings. Then came the realization that most of those people have yet to be born.

We, who defy the Sacred, many-tentacled Lie we were born to, have no ally more potent than the unborn.

(James LaFond)

becoming sane is something like a worldview shift to a worldview we do not grasp

2021-06-03 13:18:39

neuroasketic

neuroasketic

i think a lot about the school of the sane

i spent gym time today meditating upon the descriptive passages:

Becoming ‚Äúsane‚Äù meant experiencing some kind of sudden enlightenment. The student becomes vastly more intelligent, but their intelligence changes not only in degree but in kind. They are not exactly human any more. At least, they are mostly unintelligible to ordinary humans, even quite bright and gifted ones, and their motivations and purposes become opaque. Becoming sane is something like a worldview shift to a worldview we do not grasp. It something like waking up one morning to find that you have an alien‚Äôs intuitions.

Being sane appears to happen when someone extremely smart with a deep knowledge and skilled at creativity and connections suddenly hits upon some kind of re-orienting idea that suddenly shifts everything they know into a new configuration. Best evidence is that it is basically the same for all the sane, because they appear to understand each other. But they also appear to be completely unable or unwilling to explain it to us, or even to grasp that there is anything that needs to be explained. ‚ÄúSane,‚Äù however, is their term. They appear to view the rest of us as deeply mentally ill and as best we can tell, find us hard to understand.

not trivially, becoming sane in this sense would require/result in deep-sixing all of yr current ambitions & goals to replace them w/ higher aims

& that is part of the price we r √± willing to pay

have you shackles? enumerate

you chose them. u picked them out lovingly, u polish them, and they are yrs

you choose yr own diseases

u r insane for knowable and in many cases known reasons

in the wild, most individuals do not live past their first year

2021-06-02 12:53:51

neuroasketic

neuroasketic

in the fox/hedgehog dichotomy i think of myself as a polar fox. i try to have principles that generate opinions rather than the converse, and to defend those to the utmost or avoid positions in which those would be compromised. (the dark forest counsel is to avoid compromise rather than fight when possible. draw no attention)

consensus reality is a magic spell or enchantment laid over us. the extent to which someone can maintain non-consensus beliefs is a proxy for their strength of will but not a barometer of their correctness

so i am strongly inclined to give someone with a non-consensus viewpoint a hearing, whereas i am largely uninterested by a normie take.

i also recognize that most people most of the time are low-agency and very happily governed by an extremely rigid structure. therefore one cannot judge them too harshly for being what they are; one is cut from the same cloth

he that diggeth a pit shall fall into it

2021-05-31 12:42:37

neuroasketic

neuroasketic

i find that i hedge up my way in many instances by making the assumption that future versions of me are going to be low-agency. that is, rather than assume that my agency will increase, i worry about scenarios in which i do not have control or self-discipline

for example, i have slowrolled and thereby undercut my progress on several projects by a tacit assumption that i will exit the project or √± exercise control over it, that i will not harvest the fruit from the trees i plant. even in cases where this is obv absurd (such as my physical performance)

the right thing to do of course is to focus on cultivating my own agency, increasing its power reach and orbit

‚ÄúIf the iron be blunt and he do not whet the edge, then must he put to more strength.‚Äù

accidental long-term success is quickly disappearing

2021-05-30 16:44:39

neuroasketic

neuroasketic

paul town points out that the jungle of immediate gratification is a gom jabbar:

What we are seeing now is an age where people who are thoughtless are making fools of themselves, debasing themselves, and becoming slaves to their unhinged desires. Women are opting to become virtual prostitutes and men are opting to support women becoming virtual prostitutes. In the past, there was enough hassle involved in this sort of exchange that many people who would have fallen prey to the trappings of the current reality were able to succeed not based on their internal strengths but rather the limitations of the world around them. Now, the people who will succeed have to have a certain internal strength that allows them not to get caught up in smut and ‚Äúeasy money.‚Äù

Now, we will really start to see who has a genuine moral compass and who just got lucky. The time for accidental long-term success is quickly disappearing and being replaced with an environment that rewards individuals who are meticulous and consistent in their behaviors. Sure, it is disappointing that women have allowed themselves to become so debased and objectified, but it‚Äôs better to have the truth than some myth that leads people to act in a deluded manner with regards to the true nature of themselves and others.
